author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: Augmentor < `v0.6` are versions developed before Julia v0.7 so it's not registered here.

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, or 1.0.0

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Ping me in three days, and I will merge this manually.

[noblock]
Actually, never mind. This package was previously registered in METADATA. So it has already gone through name review once - it doesn't need to go through again.

I tried to create a release but ran into this error:
```
App is installed for user but the repository is not enabled
```
To retry, comment on this PR with the phrase `TagBot tag`.
cc: @christopher-dG
<!-- 8981ea80-51d8-11ea-8fcf-df6cf3d6b3e5 -->


---

### IMPORTANT: TagBot as a GitHub App is deprecated

[TagBot as a GitHub App is deprecated](https://github.com/apps/julia-tagbot); you should now migrate to [TagBot as a GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/julia-tagbot).
Your repository should have received a pull request doing this for you, but if you did not receive this pull request, then see [here](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/julia-tagbot#setup) for instructions.
For more information about this deprecation, please see [this Discourse post](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-the-tagbot-github-app-is-deprecated-in-favour-of-the-tagbot-github-action/34344).

@johnnychen94 Please see the TagBot error message above.

cc: @johnnychen94 @Evizero

I actually already installed TagBot action earlier https://github.com/Evizero/Augmentor.jl/commit/bb270dc38cbf83253dd8946b7934457a47f7e384 so seems like this message from TagBot is useless (can be ignored).

Edit: it's already tagged via TagBot action.
Sorry, it posted in here because it only checked for the TagBot action at the commit being registered and the file was added more recently.
